Package com.helml.trektris.server

Class Tetromino

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.helml.trektris.server.Tetromino

  • public class Tetromino
extends java.lang.Object
    A "moveable set of blocks" called "Tetromino" for the game Tetris. There exists 7 different types of Tetrominos, each of them named by the letter they look like: I, T, L, J, Z, S, O. Each Tetromino is able to rotate.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Tetromino​(int[][][] otherMatrix, int id)
      Constructs a Tetromino object.
      Tetromino​(Tetromino other)
      Constructs a Tetromino object by copying it from another Tetromino (copy constructor).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tetromino

        public Tetromino​(int[][][] otherMatrix,
                 int id)
        Constructs a Tetromino object.
        Parameters:
        otherMatrix - 3-dim matrix representing a Tetromino including all rotation steps
        id - identifies the block of which a Tetromino consists. In standard Tetris implementations, this is going to be a value between 1 and 7 - each number representing a color, 0 means empty.

      • Tetromino

        public Tetromino​(Tetromino other)
        Constructs a Tetromino object by copying it from another Tetromino (copy constructor).
        Parameters:
        other - Tetromino to copy from

      • reset

        public void reset​(int posX,
                  int posY)
        Resets a Tetromino to a given position. Rotation is set to initial rotation step.

        Rotate a Tetromino counter clock wise.

      • toArray

        public int[][] toArray​()
        Returns the Tetromino as int-array representation.
        Returns:
        int-array representing of the current Tetromino in its current rotation step
